messages.message:
Has anyone gotten an error about generating self signed cert when building `server-nginx`?

```docker run --rm -u 501 -v /Users/lydiagu/Instabase/instabase/www-pages/build/:/www-pages \
	-w "/www-pages" \
	instabase/www-pages-build \
	/bin/bash /www-pages/build.sh
Configuration file: /www-pages/config.yml
            Source: /www-pages/src/html
       Destination: /www-pages/site
 Incremental build: disabled. Enable with --incremental
      Generating... 
                    done in 0.101 seconds.
 Auto-regeneration: disabled. Use --watch to enable.
cp -R /Users/lydiagu/Instabase/instabase/webserver/server-nginx/../../www-pages/build/static/* /Users/lydiagu/Instabase/instabase/webserver/server-nginx/build/webroot/static/
cp -R /Users/lydiagu/Instabase/instabase/webserver/server-nginx/../../www-pages/build/site/* /Users/lydiagu/Instabase/instabase/webserver/server-nginx/build/webroot/about/
# this just copies the config, tracing is enabled by "tracing: true" flag in nginx-config.json
cp config/jaeger-nginx-config.json /Users/lydiagu/Instabase/instabase/webserver/server-nginx/build/config/jaeger-nginx-config.json
./certificates/local_certs.sh
Generating RSA private key, 2048 bit long modulus
............................................................................................+++
................................................................................................................................+++
e is 65537 (0x10001)
Can't open file certificates/passphrase
Error getting password
make: *** [create-self-signed-cert] Error 1
(venv37) lydiagu@Lydias-MacBook-Pro-work server-nginx % ```
Hey there, this looks like my doing
should there be a file called passphrase?
yes, sorry let me find the instructions for this rq
If you follow those steps you should be able to get it set up correctly for local dev
Sorry about that, the short answer is trying creating a passphrase file but I think you will need to do the other steps as well
:thumbsup: should we mention it here https://github.com/instabase/frontend-docs/blob/master/local.md#nginx too?
Yeah, I can add it there also
